data.title: Single player units color and behavior
data.body:
Unify the Color and behavior of allied units and uncontrollable units like extraction helicopters.

Here is an image of a uncontrollable transport helicopter that do not reveal fog of war and is blue with a green health bar. To me as a player it is not clear to me who owns this unit.
![openra game_2016_11_30_03_32_56_391](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/20738298/6ca81f02-b6b2-11e6-9052-d8fec7d00025.png)

data.title: Automatic transfer of multiplayer maps if client does not have it
data.body:
Could not find any duplicates of this, so here we go : 
Many other remakes of older rts games uses this feature (as well as more modern ones like Warcraft III). I have been a big fan of Knights and Merchants remake (www.kamremake.com). They did implement this feature which is really nice and makes it less annoying when trying to play a custom map with friends that do not have it (since one of you created it after all). How it would work is basically when a map is selected that a client does not have, the file will be transfered to the client :+1:

data.title: A possibility to hide the replay % when watching a replay.
data.body:
It would be nice if the user is able to hide the number that shows how far the replay is in % (and turn it back on if wanted).

This to make replays more exciting to watch.

data.title: Allow the missile to snap at the target at reach.
data.body:
This is basically a bugfix against the circling-missile-bug gen2 anti-air missiles are so susceptible, due to the targets being too fast to the missile, so it keeps circling around the aircraft.

It's optional however because gen1 mods are balanced around semiaccurate missiles and I don't want to affect that balance, TS also had accurate missiles though which is why it's enabled there.

data.title: Keybinds Activated Twice
data.body:
Description: In game all keybinds act as if they were pressed twice instantly. Pressing f1 creates 2 units instead of one, pressing enter opens chat then closes it instantly.

Platform: I'm running archlinux (64 bit) using the i3 window manager. I installed the openra community package using pacman. When I run the game using dmenu everything works fine, however when I run using the .desktop or by just typing openra into a terminal, the bug occurs. I don't know why launching it using dmenu works, but it is my current solution to the problem.

data.title: Extreme game lag when AI has no path
data.body:
Playing the original C&C game on OpenRA and there is a map that is divided across the middle with a river and 4 bridges.  If you destroy all 4 bridges, when an AI on the other side of the bride is the only remaining AI, the game starts lagging immensely.

I'm not familiar with the code base, but my guess is the AI is trying to figure out what to do and has nothing to wait around for so it's constantly reevaluating

data.title: Make MP start units facings customizable
data.body: There might be modders or mappers who prefer different initial facing settings than the hardcoded ones.

data.title: Passengers' ProvidesPrerequisite is ignored.
data.body:
So I have a neutral mercenary faction with a hero. I had this idea that by capturing the mercenary tech building, the player can either
 - build the merc barracks and train the hero normally
 - call in a paradrop of an APC-akin with the hero inside.

I put a ProvidesPrerequisite on the hero which prevents the APC call-in when he's around, however when he's sitting in the APC, the paradrop is still available. Note that I consider the APC disposable, so it's not the APC which should prevent that paradrop, but only the hero.

Semi-related to #5872.

data.title: Make RA and TD aircraft reveal shroud from the point on the ground below them.
data.body: Fixes #12330.

data.title: Add CliffBackImpassabilityLayer to TS.
data.body: This fixes units from moving deep behind cliffs where they are not supposed to go, and wraps up the set of heightmap improvements that I had planned for this release cycle.

data.title: Implement TS ground-level bridges.
data.body: This finishes and closes #8916. Depends on #12371.

data.title: Add TS Firestorm installation
data.body:
Supersedes #12113.

Fixed minor issues, added a quickinstall package and temporarily added alternative mirror lists.

Note: The mirrored packages will stay online at least until we have some additional mirrors, but the mirror list files of openra.net need to be updated before this is merged.

data.title: Make deploy key set primary on buildings
data.body: Using left click orders makes setting a primary on a building much more label intensive than it needs to be.

data.title: Chat doesn't stay open
data.body: When I join a multiplayer game and press enter to chat, the chat box appears for a very short time and then disappears again.

data.title: ReplayMetadata style fix
data.body:
Somehow the style issues in #12357 were not caught by Travis (maybe it didn't run?).
They make Travis fail on bleed-based PRs, so this should be merged asap.

data.title: Fix missing array bounds check in Shroud.IsExplored.
data.body: Fixes #12418.

data.title: northern shroud bug
data.body: I dont know if you all would call this a bug or not, i think it is. Anyway if you move units of any kind behind the northern shroud edge of the map all units and static defences wont trigger the attack by themselves. this allows you to sneak behind enemy base with for exemple a load of rocket soldiers in chinooks, without having to be afraid of the aa guns or missle defences or rocket soldiers placed there by the enemy team. I dont think this is an intentional thing. Let me know what you guys think of this. Cheers Ohmk Torque

data.title: request for formation option
data.body: i remember from the oldschool red alert, that there was an update in which they implied an option to make the selected units move in the formation in which they stood when you implied the command. The command was "ctrl f".  it would be great if this was implemented in the openra version of the game to. It allows your selected units not only to stay in formation, but also to adjust the speed of the group to the slowest unit in the group. I think it was a great addition to the oldschool red alert which unlocked cool new strategies. I'm curious what you guys think of this request.

data.title: Clean up duplicated code fragments
data.body:
[dupFinder](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/resharper/2016.2/dupFinder.html) runs daily via @AppVeyor. #8435 It is a bit hidden in the artifacts section:
https://ci.appveyor.com/api/buildjobs/4838qmba6kwdq659/artifacts/dupReport.html was tonight's list.

data.title: Chat (type) visibility selection for the replay viewer
data.body:
It would be nice, for reviewing and/or casting purposes, to be able to toggle:

- viewing spectator (team) chat (default on)
- viewing other teams chat  (default off)
- public chat (default on)

For casting is will give less distractions when all are off, while spectator/team chats may provide insights when reviewing.

I am not sure if you should be able to toggle them only beforehand or whether it should be toggles that can be changed "replay time".

data.title: Red Alert Crash - fixit1.aud is not a valid sound file
data.body:

I was playing a skirmish game in Red Alert with openra-bleed, when the following error occurred:

----------------------------------------------

   bei OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Armament.CheckFire(Actor self, IFacing facing, Target target)

I guess it could be, that the file is corrupt, but as everything else was working I'm not sure, that's the case.
Is there a crc-check when extracting the files from the Original discs?

And if it was corrupted, how do I get it extracted again (and from which disc)?

data.title: Make rendersprites trait is upgradable
Crash for Bleeding post 11/7
data.body:
We compile bleeding builds before playing, and since 11/7 and before 11/20 we noted a bug where the game will crash to the desktop after a fixed period of time. We've observed it both at the multiplayer game host screen (after waiting 5-10 minutes or so) and post starting a game, same bug.

Attached are the crash logs. Looks like some array overflows.
[Logs.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/609413/Logs.zip)

data.title: [Idea] missions seqense
data.body:
Now, if we finish single player mission, we can only quit in main menu.
"Next mission" and "Return to mission list" buttons after finish any mission will be very userful I think.

data.title: Nerf Rusher Strategy
data.body: I'm sure most of you have encountered it where people amassed an army early on, and there was no counter, that needs to be nerfed somehow.

data.title: Tank traps are missing from the map editor.
data.body: As the title says,  Tank Traps 1 & 2 are both missing from the map editor's selection list.

data.title: [Tiket] make SpawnActorOnDeath trait is upgradabe
data.body: If it will spawn actors with KillsSelf: depending on the unit upgrades it wold be niser than make upgradable many other treats of unit to totaly transform it.

data.title: It will play multiplayer fine, but won't play Skirmish or Singleplayer at ALL.
data.body: it doesn't crash when i try to play SP, rather, i can click on "play" all day and it won't do nothing.

data.title: Crash: Out of memory on long games
data.body:
Playing in skirmish mode, RA, I keep getting crashes. Not sure of anything particular causing it, but I've noticed it at least since the 20161015 version. It occurs after playing very long matches (what can I say, I'm a turtle) with perhaps rather large numbers of units, which I'm guessing is no coincidence based on the "out of memory".

I noticed in this specific match that the game was lagging, and that some of the opponents had a remarkable number of units. So I took to nuking them, and it seemed like the lagging was getting better, but then the game crashed shortly after. So it can't be a matter of too many units at once.

Is this a problem that can be fixed, or do I need to finish my games faster?

```

on map 00543f7710ccc9b1e11f7be843736871e164b7be (Encumbrance by Comrade Tiki).
Date: 2016-11-22 02:41:36Z
```

data.title: Fix crash when actors with multiple RevealsShroud target a dead frozen actor.
data.body: This should fix the crash that @SoScared and co encountered in their gapgen playtest stream.
